text: The 1995 Welsh local elections, were held on 4 May in the 22 new local authorities, as part of the wider 1995 UK local elections. ==Wales-Wide Results== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:right;" |- !colspan=2 | Party ! scope="col" | Votes ! scope="col" | % ! scope="col" | +/- ! scope="col" | Councils ! scope="col" | +/- ! scope="col" | Seats ! scope="col" | +/- |- |404,013 |43.6% | |14 | |726 | |- |188,352 |20.3% | |4 | |292 | |- |115,900 |12.5% | |1 | |113 | |- |95,376 |10.2% | |0 | |79 | |- |75,448 |8.1% | |0 | |42 | |- |10,161 |1.1% | |0 | |0 | |- |36,966 |4.0% | |0 | |20 | |- | n/a | n/a | n/a | 3 | | n/a | n/a |} ==Result== In all 22 Welsh councils the whole of the council was up for election. {| class="wikitable sortable" border="1" |- !
